ETYMOLOGY: Compound of easy (adj.) and going (pres. part. of go). First attested in the mid-18th century, meaning 'of a relaxed, tolerant, or lenient disposition'.

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Relaxed, tolerant, and not easily worried, annoyed, or provoked; having a placid or lenient disposition.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 随和的；宽容的；不爱操心的；脾气好的
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: My boss is surprisingly easygoing and lets us manage our own time.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 我的老板出奇地随和，让我们自己管理时间。

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Characterized by a lack of strictness, structure, or discipline; relaxed in pace or schedule.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 轻松自在的；不拘束的；缺乏严格安排的
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: They enjoy an easygoing island lifestyle, waking up whenever they want.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 他们享受着轻松自在的岛屿生活，想什么时候醒来就什么时候醒来。

REGISTER: Common usage in informal and formal conversation, describing temperament or style.
